intro: Oxypetalum heptalobum, commonly known as the seven-lobed oxypetalum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and have seven lobes, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
